segments.text: I can’t believe how messy this kitchen is getting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is everywhere, and the woman is just standing there like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are making it worse by climbing on that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They’re going to get hurt, and the woman won’t even know why.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is going to be ruined, and the cabinets are already soaked.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m watching a disaster unfold in slow motion.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: No one is paying attention to what really matters here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so focused on her dish that she can’t see the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being reckless, and no one is stopping them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would just turn off the water and put an end to this mess.
segments.speaker: PAR
